Tests are now working! Tested in Win7 IE8, WinXP IE8 IE7 and IE6. Now using strictEqual instead of ok for better reporting when tests fail. Tried to shrink the tests down a little better so they work in browserstack (which only goes up to 1280x1024).
A little restructuring to allow more internal qunit tests to actually run when media queries are supported.
When body does not exist, this was throwing an Illegal Argument error in IE8.
Restrict this test to IE8 and below until we expose respond.ajax when MQ are supported.

Add warning about Sass source maps to README

Add bower.json

This file allows this package to be installed using Bower. The package
has already been registered as `respond` in the Bower package registry.
It can now be installed by executing:

  bower install respond

More information on Bower can be found at:

  https://github.com/bower/bower
  http://bower.io
Reset the font-size of html and body before measuring the em value.
Allows space before colon (min-width : 30em) due to blog post issue reported here: http://esbueno.noahstokes.com/post/45696422922/issue-with-respond-js-ie8-and-your-media-queries
Little bit more flexible syntax in MQ allows white-space between opening ( and min/max-width. White-space was already allowed prior to ending ).

use strict errors?

setTimeout and clearTimeout are methods of window
Added support for protocol-relative URLs in CSS file references in cross-domain JS.
spelling fix.
Fixed mistake in readme
wrapped recursive call to makeRequests in setTimeout to previent "stack overflow" in ie7
Modified the minw and maxw match statements in order to match css expressions that have white space preceding the colon (still valid css syntax).

Adding test for IE9 in iframes

Internet Explorer 9 supports css3 media queries, but not within frames
(this appears to be a bug in IE9). Modifying this script to check for
IE9 and check if within iframe and run if true.
Trimming whitespace.
Resolves Issue #59: Cross domain CSS files with ? in URL won't load

Resolves issue #100: CDN/x-domain setup fails in IE7 and IE6 when <base> tag is used

- Suppresses a false-positive when a <base> element exists but no link protocol is found.
- The x-domain script now correctly tests for the existence of a <base> element and proxies/redirects using that reference.

Merge pull request #87 from fabiomcosta/patch-1

This space is not always present.
add em unit support mention to readme.
Fix for Firefox 3 error: "TypeError: sheet.styleSheet is undefined", extra object detection to prevent error
Added GPLv2 to the comments about licenses.
IE6 & IE7 don't build out absolute urls in <link /> attributes. So respond.proxy.gif remains relative instead of http://example.com/respond.proxy.gif. This trickery resolves that issue.
README updated as Cross Domain requests are now supported https://github.com/scottjehl/Respond/commit/3500e865e50f492f6091fb01f3c92e76fa32df87
Added selectivizr compatibility via the 'rawCssText' styleSheet expando property. Selectivizr script must be run first.
Make Respond.js work on IE8 for documents with “www.” URLs. Fixes #20. Thanks, @Kingsquare!
This was probably just a one-character bug here, fixed it
